title: Tired of playing with bots in my team
body:
Last 4 games I played had a total of 12 bots in (no runes, no items, run down mid and die repeatedly). Worst one was me stuck with 4 bots. Can't leave the game cos I will get penalised.
This is ruining the game, I come here to play with other players, not to help people level up accounts to sell.

replies.body:
First of all, love your name! :)

As for the bots, [Riot is working on the bot problem all the time](https://boards.oce.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-strategy/78Nvd6pV-can-we-please-just-ip-ban-players-who-use-bot-programs-to-play-the-game?comment=0000000100000000), but it's a little tricky to stomp all of them.

Bots freaking suck, and it shouldn't be on the players to take steps to prevent playing with them, but given the ease of creation and the sheer volume of these accounts it's easier said than done to fix.

Bots are typically prevalent in low level co-op vs AI and low level and low MMR (skill rating) ARAM, so hitting level 30 or avoiding those modes is the easiest way to avoid bots if you wish to take that route.
That's so sad... Riot don't give a fuckkkkkkkkkkk. They're chilling sitting in Hawaii sipping on mochitos laughing at their game
There is bots in every popular games. Take wow for example. BOTS, cheaters. Is this the only online game you play?
one year later, havent seen a single real player in my team since I downloaded the game again a month ago
the easy option is to take down those websites that sell accounts

An option? Yes. Easy? certainly not.

Bottom line, Riot *could* attempt to take legal action and have the websites taken down, *however* that isn't going to stop people from making and distributing the bot programs. Just look at the case of "internet piracy". Websites for that are *always* being taken down, time and time again, and yet it hasn't done anything to stop people from streaming/downloading stuff. Several of the more common websites for it have been taken down dozens, if not hundreds, of times and yet they still continue to exist, and generally they will have multiple domains active at any given time.

From what I understand, that's currently not the case with bot/script programs that are used in LoL. Since they don't have the constant "chase" of having sites taken down all the time, they generally stick to only a single domain for each site, and don't tend to change anything about the sites. If anything, that would (arguably) make it easier for Riot to keep track of the more common programs being used, even being able to obtain a copy of the programs and more effectively figure out how to detect them.
